channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Glass, 7th May
item.description:
Lots of glass in the alley near to Gristmill Close Some by the park entrance too. Where there’s blame there’s a claim.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 26 Gristmill Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in Mill Lane, 7th May
item.description:
Household waste with possible evidence of culprits address as envelopes/post are strewn around

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Glenfall Lodge Mill Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge holes in road at junction, 7th May
item.description:
Extensive number of holes in road now joining together to an extent that there is now less road remaining than the sections which are missing!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Unit r Kingsville Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface disintegrating, 7th May
item.description:
More than just a pothole. The road is totally breaking down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Kingsville Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 pot holes, 6th May
item.description:
2 pot holes that need filing as it is hard to avoid with parked cars on the other side
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Millham Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Large pot holes, 6th May
item.description:
There are a collection of large pot holes along the road that have been filled for years. We’re fooled a few weeks ago and now open again

item.title: Deep pothole, 5th May
item.description:
There's a hole in the road that's about half a mile deep. People are swerving to miss it. It's going to cause an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 187 Old Bath Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Broken kurb moving and broken, 5th May

item.title: No signs telling cyclists to dismount, 5th May
item.description:
Every day cyclists use pavement closest to govt building riding close to/into pedestrians instead of using the raid or cycle path across the road. When challenged, they claim the pavement is a cycle path despite it not being marked as such and being too narrow for pedestrians and cyclists to safely coexist. That cyclists ignore their cycle path had been clear since they were created a few months ago, up until then it could be argued they should receive the benefit of the doubt.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hubble Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches obscuring cycle path signs, 5th May
item.description:
Cycle path signs completely hidden by branches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 23 Coburn Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown footpath, 5th May
item.description:
Footpath very overgrown making it difficult to walk along. Fence and hedging either side so unable to detour around the issue hence decided to report instead.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Wickfield Lane, Cleeve Hill
